==Events==
* [[379]] &ndash; Emperor [[Gratian]] elevates [[Theodosius I|Flavius Theodosius]] at [[Sirmium]] to ''[[Augustus (honorific)|Augustus]]'', and gives him power over all the eastern provinces of the [[Roman Empire]].
* [[639]] &ndash; [[Clovis II]], king of [[Neustria]] and [[Kingdom of Burgundy|Burgundy]], is crowned.
* [[649]] &ndash; [[Conquest of Kucha]]: The forces of Kucha surrender after a forty-day [[siege]] led by [[Tang Dynasty]] general Ashina She'er, establishing Tang control over the northern [[Tarim Basin]] in [[Xinjiang]].
*[[1419]] &ndash; [[Hundred Years' War]]: [[Rouen]] surrenders to [[Henry V of England]], completing his reconquest of [[Normandy]].
*[[1511]] &ndash; [[Mirandola]] surrenders to the French.
*[[1520]] &ndash; [[Sten Sture the Younger]], the [[List of Swedish monarchs|Regent of Sweden]], is mortally wounded at the [[Battle of Bogesund]].
*[[1607]] &ndash; [[San Agustin Church, Manila|San Agustin Church in Manila]] is officially completed; it is the oldest church still standing in the [[Philippines]].
*[[1661]] &ndash; [[Thomas Venner]] is [[hanged, drawn and quartered]] in [[London]].
*[[1764]] &ndash; [[John Wilkes]] is expelled from the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|British House of Commons]] for [[seditious libel]].
*[[1788]] &ndash; The second group of ships of the [[First Fleet]] arrive at [[Botany Bay]].
*[[1795]] &ndash; The [[Batavian Republic]] is proclaimed in the Netherlands bringing to an end the [[Republic of the Seven United Netherlands]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; The United Kingdom occupies the [[Cape of Good Hope]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Peninsular War]]: After a ten-day siege, [[Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington]], orders British soldiers of the Light and third divisions to storm [[Ciudad Rodrigo]].
*[[1817]] &ndash; An army of 5,423 soldiers, led by General [[José de San Martín]], [[Crossing of the Andes|crosses the Andes]] from [[Argentina]] to liberate [[Chile]] and then [[Peru]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; [[Johann Wolfgang von Goethe]]'s ''[[Faust Part 1]]'' receives its premiere performance.
*[[1839]] &ndash; The [[British East India Company]] captures [[Aden]].
*[[1840]] &ndash; Captain [[Charles Wilkes]] circumnavigates Antarctica, claiming what became known as [[Wilkes Land]] for the United States.
*[[1853]] &ndash; [[Giuseppe Verdi]]'s [[opera]] ''[[Il Trovatore]]'' receives its premiere performance in Rome.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] joins [[South Carolina]], [[Florida]], [[Mississippi]], and [[Alabama]] in [[secession|seceding]] from the United States.
*[[1862]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of Mill Springs]] &ndash; The [[Confederate States of America|Confederacy]] suffers its first significant defeat in the conflict.
*[[1871]] &ndash; [[Franco-Prussian War]]: In the [[Siege of Paris (1870-1871)|Siege of Paris]], [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussia]] wins the [[Battle of St. Quentin (1871)|Battle of St. Quentin]]. Meanwhile, the French attempt to break the siege in the [[Battle of Buzenval (1871)|Battle of Buzenval]] will end unsuccessfully the following day.
*[[1883]] &ndash; The first electric lighting system employing overhead wires, built by [[Thomas Edison]], begins service at [[Roselle, New Jersey]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; [[Henrik Ibsen]]'s [[Play (theatre)|play]] ''[[The Master Builder]]'' receives its premiere performance in Berlin.
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Anglo-Egyptian Sudan]] is formed.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Georges Claude]] patents the [[neon]] [[Neon lighting|discharge]] tube for use in [[advertising]].
*  1915   &ndash; [[World War I]]: German [[zeppelin]]s bomb the towns of [[Great Yarmouth]] and [[King's Lynn]] in the United Kingdom killing more than 20, in the first major aerial bombardment of a civilian target.
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[Silvertown explosion]]: 73 are killed and 400 injured in an explosion in a munitions plant in London.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] votes against joining the [[League of Nations]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Jockey International|Coopers Inc.]] sells the world's first [[briefs]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Howard Hughes]] sets a new air record by flying from [[Los Angeles, California]] to New York City in 7 hours, 28 minutes, 25 seconds.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Japanese forces invade [[Burma]]
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[Red Army|Soviet]] forces liberate the [[Ghetto Litzmannstadt|Łódź ghetto]]. Of more than 200,000 inhabitants in 1940, less than 900 had survived the [[Nazism|Nazi]] occupation.
*[[1946]] &ndash; General [[Douglas MacArthur]] establishes the [[International Military Tribunal for the Far East]] in Tokyo to try Japanese [[war crimes|war criminals]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Cuba]] recognizes [[Israel]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; 71.7% of all [[television]] sets in the United States are tuned into ''[[I Love Lucy]]'' to watch [[Lucy Ricardo|Lucy]] [[Lucy Goes to the Hospital|give birth]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; Japan and the United States sign the [[Treaty of Mutual Cooperation and Security between the United States and Japan|US-Japan Mutual Security Treaty]]
*[[1969]] &ndash; Student [[Jan Palach]] dies after setting himself on fire 3 days earlier in [[Prague]]'s [[Wenceslas Square]] to protest about the invasion of [[Czechoslovakia]] by the [[Soviet Union]] in 1968. His [[funeral]] turned into another major protest.
*[[1974]] &ndash; China gain control over all the [[Paracel Islands]] after [[Battle of the Paracel Islands|a military engagement]] between the naval forces of the [[People's Republic of China]] and Republic of Vietnam ([[South Vietnam]])
*[[1975]] &ndash; An [[1975 Kinnaur earthquake|earthquake strikes]] [[Himachal Pradesh]], India
*[[1977]] &ndash; President [[Gerald Ford]] pardons [[Iva Toguri D'Aquino]] (a.k.a. "[[Tokyo Rose]]").
*  1977   &ndash; [[Snow]] falls in [[Miami, Florida]]. This is the only time in the [[History of Miami|history of the city]] that snow has fallen. It also fell in the [[Bahamas]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; The last [[Volkswagen Beetle]] made in Germany leaves VW's plant in [[Emden, Germany|Emden]]. Beetle production in [[Latin America]] continues until 2003.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Iran Hostage Crisis]]: United States and [[Iran]]ian officials sign an agreement to release 52 American hostages after 14 months of captivity.
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Nazi]] war criminal [[Klaus Barbie]] is arrested in [[Bolivia]].
*  1983   &ndash; The [[Apple Lisa]], the first commercial [[personal computer]] from [[Apple Inc.]] to have a [[graphical user interface]] and a [[computer mouse]], is announced.
*[[1986]] &ndash; The first [[IBM PC]] [[computer virus]] is released into the wild. A boot sector virus dubbed [[Brain (computer virus)|(c)Brain]], it was created by the Farooq Alvi Brothers in [[Lahore]], [[Pakistan]], reportedly to deter piracy of the software they had written.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Gulf War]]: [[Iraq]] fires a second [[Scud]] missile into [[Israel]], causing 15 injuries.
*[[1993]] &ndash; Czech Republic and [[Slovakia]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; After being struck by lightning the crew are forced to ditch [[Bristow Flight 56C]]. All 18 aboard are later rescued.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The barge ''[[North Cape (ship)|North Cape]]'' oil spill occurs as an engine fire forces the tugboat ''Scandia'' ashore on Moonstone Beach in [[South Kingstown, Rhode Island]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Yasser Arafat]] returns to [[Hebron]] after more than 30 years and joins celebrations over the handover of the last Israeli-controlled [[West Bank]] city.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[British Aerospace]] agrees to acquire the defence subsidiary of the [[General Electric Company plc]], forming [[BAE Systems]] in November 1999.
*[[2006]] &ndash; The [[New Horizons]] probe is launched by [[NASA]] on the first mission to [[Pluto]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; Turkish Journalist [[Hrant Dink]] is assassinated in front of his newspaper's office by 17-year-old Turkish ultra-nationalist Ogün Samast.
*[[2012]] &ndash; The Hong Kong-based file-sharing website [[Megaupload]] is shut down by the [[FBI]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; A failed attempt to assassinate [[Ahmed Dogan]], chairman of the [[Bulgaria]]n political party [[Movement for Rights and Freedoms]], on live television is foiled by security guards.
*[[2014]] &ndash; A [[2014 Bannu bombing|bomb attack]] on an army convoy in the city of [[Bannu]] kills at least 26 soldiers and injures 38 others.

==Holidays and observances==
*Birthday of [[Edgar Allan Poe]] (commemorated by the [[Poe Toaster]] at his grave in [[Baltimore]])
*Christian [[Feast Day]]:
**[[Bishop Henry|Henry of Uppsala]]
**[[Marius, Martha, Audifax, and Abachum]]
**[[St. Mark of Ephesus|Mark of Ephesus]]
**[[Pontianus of Spoleto]]
**[[Wulfstan (Bishop of Worcester)|Wulfstan, Bishop of Worcester]]
**[[January 19 (Eastern Orthodox liturgics)]]

*[[Confederate Memorial Day|Confederate Heroes Day]] ([[Texas]]), and its related observance:
**[[Robert E. Lee Day]] ([[Alabama]], [[Arkansas]], [[Florida]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] and [[Mississippi]])

*Earliest day on which [[Man's Day and Woman's Day (Iceland)|Husband's Day]] or ''Bóndadagur'' can fall, while January 25 is the latest; celebrated on Friday between 19 and 25 January ([[Iceland]])
*Feast of Sultán (Sovereignty), first day of the 17th month of the [[Bahá'í calendar]] ([[Bahá'í Faith]])
*[[Theophany]] / [[Epiphany (feast)|Epiphany]] ([[Eastern Orthodoxy|Eastern]] and [[Oriental Orthodoxy]]), and its related observances:
**[[Timkat]], or 20 during Leap Year ([[Ethiopian Orthodox]])
**''[[Public holidays in the Republic of Macedonia|Vodici]]'' or [[Baptism of Jesus]] ([[Republic of Macedonia]])
